main event: On May 7th, 1959, in the Taft, California area, a civilian observed a silver object, possibly the size of a basketball, moving like a ball or balloon with the wind at a lower craft level.
interesting points: The object was possibly identified as a balloon but displayed unusual behavior for a balloon, moving with the wind at a lower craft level.
The object was observed to be the size of a basketball at a distance of 30 to 1200 yards and continued in a straight flight level.
There was no sound associated with the object, and it looked like a ball of fire with a constant flight level.
The observation duration was noted to be incredibly short, only 1.5 seconds.
Two different aircraft in the area also reported sighting the object, adding credibility to the observation.
sighted object: silver object, possibly the size of a basketball, moving with the wind
